channel.title: Git on juri.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Git on juri.dev

item.title: Productive Git for Developers
item.description: With this Egghead course, I aim at a different goal. You will walk through a series of scenarios which youâ€™ll most commonly encounter in your daily work life as a developer.

item.title: GitLab Flow
item.description: I’ve already published a couple of Git guides on my blog here Git Explained: For Beginners Implementing the “Git flow” Git Flow with Jenkins and GitLab The main reason is because I needed it as a documentation for my work mates.

item.title: GitHub: be Social, Contribute, Learn
item.description: GitHub revolutionised the open source world by building - IMHO - the first true social coding site. It has never been that easy to contribute to a project, whether it is to simply discuss some new features, to file a bug or in the best case to submit a bug fix or new feature patch: a pull request (PR).

item.title: Migrate from TFS to Git
item.description: Are you using TFS and would like to switch to a distributed VCS like Git? Well then this article might be of help. I quickly wrote down the required steps and some hints for exporting an existing TFS repository to Git.

item.title: Implementing the 'Git flow'
item.description: Git can be used in a variety of ways which is cool. But still, when working within a team, it is good to have a consensus on a common, shared approach in order to avoid conflicts.

item.title: Git flow with Jenkins and GitLab
item.description: At work I recently helped a team to transition from TFS to using Git as their source control management. After introducing the members to Git, we also established a common workflow on how we wanted to have Git integrate with Jenkins and GitLab.

item.title: Git Explained: For Beginners
item.description: I’m working with Git now for about two years but only for my personal projects and those I have on GitHub. At work we still use TFS and SVN (as of now).

item.title: Choose Your Commit Messages Properly
item.description: I wrote already a couple of posts about version control stuff and best practices related with it. So today, what about proper commit messages?

item.title: Juri Goes GIT - First Steps
item.description: Yes, I'm going "git" ;). An inherent part of structured, well organized working is to have your stuff under version control (1st point on the Joel Test).

item.title: Best practices: VCS usage flowchart
item.description: So now there’s the graphical representation of my yesterday’s post. Computer scientists usually understand these graphs better ;) Comments, critics or improvements are very welcome.
